intro: Nevroloma, commonly known as the "false lily," is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bulbs are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. However, it is important to note that some species of Nevroloma can be toxic if ingested.
